dialogues.speaker: FADE IN

FROM OVER THE HORIZON comes a figure. The rising heat dis its image. We can barely make out what it is. It rides cl closer...IT IS A LONE HORSEMAN, however he is still too f see anything but that...A WOMAN'S VOICE begins to narrate rides.

Still, we cannot see wh Out of the sand they built an Empire...Their civilization grew fast and strong. The lone horseman draws nearer. He dons a military unifor machine gun is slung across his back. For themselves they rewrote history and created time itself. They were powerful. They were unstopable. They were...the Planet of the Apes! The lone horseman comes to an abrupt stop. He pulls the s from his face. It is GENERAL IZAN, the blackest of the bl gorillas.

The blood-red sky soaking all the color fro picture except red itself. We watch the war sear on in SL MOTION. The on lors...black and red.

It {is the focal point of activity for occa social and governmental importance. The mighty Square is with great stone pillars that reach skyward. Today it is with the excitement and emotions of peace. The gorillas a chimpanzees are about to end their savage, bloody civil w The MASSES cheer. THE REVIEWING STAND...An open-air, bleacher-type stone st Banners and flags decorate the site. Seated side by side MINISTER ELIZAR TAFARA, the leader of the entire gorilla population, and SECRETARY NEBB GURIO, his chimpanzee coun They are flanked by invited GUESTS and MILITARY AIDS, all and-polished in their dress uniforms. Amongst the dignita the three highest court JUDGES...they are the eldest memb the ape community, and the only three orangutans left in existence. The CHIEF JUDGE, DR. ZANTHEUS, impressive in h black judicial robe, approaches the giant ramshorn-like megaphone. He holds out his long arms to silence the crow

dialogues.speaker: DR. ZANTHEUS
dialogues.text: Fellow anthropoids...I stand before you today with a most inflated sense of pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This day is truly a shining monument that will go down in our history for all of ape and apekind. Applause rolls like thunder.

dialogues.speaker: DR ZANTHEUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Countless lives have been senselessly sacrificed to the thundering storms of civil war. For 2 been re But now I can see the sun shining through the clouds. Once again gorillas and chimpanzees will live in harmony... The ape population EXPLODES INTO PANDEMONIOUS CHEERS. Gur Tafara step to the megaphone. Tafara is an imposing goril chest is decorated with a legion of military ornaments. G though smaller, still presents a confident posture. He we patch over one eye. Dr Zantheus holds up a scroll. It as long awaited peace treaty.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ZANTHEUS, (CONT)
dialogues.text: I present to you Minister Elizar Tafara and Secretary Nebb Gurio, two apes of peace.

dialogues.speaker: TAFARA
dialogues.text: (bellowing out) Thank you, Dr. Zantheus, Secretar Gurio...As Commander of the Gorilla forces I speak for all the brave gorillas who have fought so valiantly under the brilliant military leadership of our General Izan. Today we extend the hand of friendship to our brother apes, the chimpanzees. Tafara salutes Gurio. They wave to the cheering masses.

dialogues.speaker: GURIO
dialogues.text: Chimpanzees have always been advocates of peace, and so I sign this treaty with great hope, and vow that never again shall any ape fight against his brother. Embracing the moment the symphony strikes up a rousing po tune. Ceremoniously Dr. Zantheus unravels the scroll. Two DIGNITARIES step up to the lecturn and each hand Gurio an a special pen. Simultaneously Gurio and Tafara sign the t Enthusiastically Dr. Zantheus holds the signed document a his head. The music swells with patriotism. Everyone on t reviewing stand is on their feet applauding vigorously. G Tafara extend their hairy hands to each other. Ina final gesture of peace, this historic handshake will solidify of hope, when, SUDDENLY...

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: STAND LIKE A BOLT OF LIGHTENING. Tafara's face explodes o skull as bullets riddle his flesh. Gasps and screams of t echo from the crowd. A BULLET SHATTERS GURIO'S SHOULDER. Three chimpanzee BODY throw him to the ground behind the podium. They shroud hi Bullets tear into their backs.

dialogues.text: The bursts from Izan's machine guns flash like strobe lig

dialogues.text: Shock and horror bulge his eyeballs. His nervous system e into one final convulsion before death. Mass confusion ab There is no escape from Izan's unexpected rampage. Apes s in all directions. A stream of bullets riddles through th symphony. Instruments and musicians fly helter-skelter. T CORPSE hangs over the podium. Blood pouring from his head Chimpanzee soldiers grab Gurio from underneath the pile o bodyguards. They wisk him off the reviewing stand, disapp into the confusion. Izan, in a bravado display of hulkish strength and ego, l onto the reviewing stand. He reaches under Tafara's blood corpse, and yanks out the peace treaty. Holding it skywar drips with Tafara's blood. With a heart stopping roar, he into the megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: There will be no peace until the gorillas rule this planet! Izan then tears the peace treaty apart and shoots into th Any hope for an end to the civil war has now been single destroyed by I[zan. I will own this planet!!

dialogues.speaker: TIME LAPSE DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: APE SQUARE...All the crowds are gone. The burned and bull shredded flags flap silently. The distant rumble of canno can be heard, a grim reminder that deep in the desert the rages on. A clean-up crew of HUMAN SLAVES sweeps the debr from the massacre. Human beings in the ape community are regarded as animals. They do not speak and are seemingly mindless. Each slave's ankles are bound in chains. Milita GORILLAS keep a watchful cruel eye on the labor force. Th crack of a whip across a slave's back is the main deteren sluffing off.

dialogues.text: For the first time we see life as it evolves on a daily b The ape civilization is almost reminiscent of ancient Rom Busy narrow streets lined with stone buildings wind and w throughout. The streets are frenzied with bazaars and VEN GORILLA TROOPS can be seen on almost every corner. The go have the city occupied and take pleasure in intimidating civilian apes. Ocassionally motorized military wagons mak way down the crowded claustrophobic streets. All slave la done by the HUMANS under the watchful eye and cracking wh the gorillas. From the middle of a city street we CRANE UP above the ro looking far into the desert which surrounds the city. The see a distant battle being raged. The mortar fire and exp ring louder and louder...

dialogues.text: A_motorized military wagon sitting ominously on the deser Tt lies in wait in the blazing noonday sun like a spider snag a fly, when all of a sudden...A Al K HAIRY HAND reache to the pictu a ck the vehic off the ground. The sounds of battle fade out as we... PULL BACK to reveal we are not actually in the desert, bu IZAN'S STRATEGY TABLE, which sits in the middle of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gorilla war room is a mess. Broken chairs and documen strewn about. Giant maps line the walls. On one side ther massive stone desk. The nameplate atop it reads: GENERAL Standing at the strategy table are Izan with several of h battle COMMANDERS and war ADVISORS. The table is a miniature battlefield. There is no doubt I in control. Everyape waits patiently as Izan amuses himse throws his toy vehicle onto the table, making explosion n with his big gorilla lips.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Okay, now where were we?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Well siz, with a fully equipped attack force taking the hill we probably won't face any substantial casualties, which should more than compensate for the losses suffered in the southeastern zone last week- end. As the Commander babbles on, Izan's brow furrows. He slow begins to pace behind Commander #1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately we were caught with our pants down, sir as the chimps mounted a surprise attack on us before most of the company had awakened, sir. It was only lucky that we...

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: We suffered losses in the southeastern zone and nobody told me?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Well sir, in a manner of speaking. However... Izan takes his machine gun and unexpectedly, WHACK, he st the Commander in the back of the head like a baseball pla The Commander falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Caught with our pants down? Izan beats him with the butt of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: I'm trying to win a war here and I don't have time for incompetence! I hate suffering losses! I HATE

dialogues.speaker: SUFFERING LOSSES
dialogues.text: AT THAT MOMENT there {s a commotion in the hall. The door open. A Chimpanzee comes rushing in followed by two bruti gorilla PRIVATES chasing after him. The Privates seize th intruder and tackle him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on here? As the Privates yank the chimp to his feet, we see he is CORNELIUS.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Unhand me! Unhand me at once!

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE
dialogues.text: Sorry General Izan, sir. This little chimp got away from us for a second. We'll take him out back and shoot him right away. As the Privates drag Cornelius across the floor...

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: General Izan, please, I beg a moment of your time! My name is Cornelius. I'm the head of the Simiantarian Peace Organization, and what I have to say concerns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the destiny of all simian life as we know it.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Wait! The Privates stop in their tracks. I know who you are. You all remember Cornelius, the chimp who was laughed out of his psychology and archeology positions for his absurd theories on anthropoid history? The gorillas laugh at Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: That is I, sir. Izan has sport with Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Not on some street corner today making those ridiculous speeches about rights for. humans or equality for all apes?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: No General, sir. I don't mean to be disrespectful, but it seems to me you're leading this Empire on a road to self- destruction. Please hear me out. Please.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Come here. Cornelius, scared but determined, approaches Izan. You have a lot of guts, you little chimp. Bither that or you're just very stupid. (laughing) What say we hear this chimp's last words? We could all use a good laugh. All the gorillas laugh with Izan.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Thank you. General Izan, if you continue with this bloody civil war...i£ you do not put down your weapons now and come to some peaceful agreement with the chimpanzees, and with yourselves...you are going to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: annihilate all life as we know it, just as was done before, when humans ruled the Planet!

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Humans ruled the planet? That's the funniest thing I've ever heard! They're animals.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: They didn't used to be. They buried their entire race by fighting each other, just like the apes are doing, General. (pleading) Don't you see, if it happened once it can happen again. If you do not open your eyes to the truth now, it'll be too late. And then my son and all the other children won't be given a chance to grow up, because we didn't give ourselves a chance to get along. The room goes dead-still. Izan thinks pensively, then...

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Kill him! They all laugh as the Privates pull Cornelius towards the

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: General, you're making a grave mistake. Why do you think the Forbidden Zone is forbidden to apes? It offers proof of what I say. I can prove the human civilization existed. I can prove that humans destroyed themselves. (desperately) I can bring you proof! Still entertained by this absurdity, Izan calls out.

dialogues.speaker: TZAN
dialogues.text: Hold it! Hold it! What kind of proof?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Proof of a human race that destroyed itself before us. Proof that will open your eyes. Proof that ape evolved from man! Hysterical laughter explodes.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: This I gotta see! The Privates let go of Cornelius' shoulders. with trepid continues.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: General Izan, if I go to the Forbidden Zone and bring you this proof, will you consider the consequesces of what I say?

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (with no sincerity) Yeah, yeah, yeah! Bring me your proof.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Thank you, General. Oh, thank you. As Cornelius nears the door, I[zan shouts to him.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Cornelius?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Yes. Izan picks up the limp corpse of Commander #1 from the fl heaves it over his head at Cornelius. THUD. The dead gori lands at Cornelius' feet. Cornelius is mortified.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Good luck. All the gorillas belly laugh with vigor. Cornelius runs f war room as fast as he can. The laughter grows and echoes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cornelius burst out of the doors and into the street. The laughing still echoes in his head. He stops in the middle road. Clutching his hands over his ears, he attempts to m the demonic laughter, which drowns out the city sounds ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cornelius rides along the desert dunes to the backdrop of expanse. His 3 year old son, PAX, shares the saddle with his left faint gunfire can be heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: THE HEAT OF DAY. Cornelius and Pax cross the hot sands se hoping. The white sun bakes down on these determined trav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT HAS FALLEN as Cornelius and Pax warm themselves at campfire he has built.

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Yes Pax.

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: Why are some apes good and some apes mean?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe someday we can figure that out together.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: THE SUN SITS HIGH IN THE SKY. Cornelius and Pax search on Dismounting they look around. A glimmer of something catc Pax's eye. Pax picks it up and hands it to his father. It arrowhead. Cornelius looks around for other signs of life sees nothing. No one. He sighs with disappointment. Have come ali this way for naught? It looks like it. He lifts e saddle.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Well Pax, it appears as if we've no place else to look. Shall we go home?...I do hope I don't hang for this. Cornelius is just about to remount his horse, when SUDDEN sack is thrust over Cornelius' head from behind. TWO HUMA a kicking and screaming Cornelius across the desert sand third grabs Pax. They all disappear into a hole in the de floor. One of the humans pulls a boulder in over the hole conceal the opening. The five are gone without a trace. A wind wisps across the sand. Cornelius’ horse stands alone

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND TUNNEL
dialogues.text: At a frenzied speed the humans drag Cornelius and Pax thr seemingly endless, claustrophobic, subterranean labyrinth muffled screams are undiscernable. The artery winds like underground corkscrew. One of the humans carries a torch casts weird shadows along the cramped wet walls. Fast. Th through the passage like blood through a vein. FINALLY... emerge in what appears to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three humans pull Cornelius and Pax through this foss was once a part of the great New York City. Torches line cracked tile walls. They race...Past an old overturned su car. Through the decrepit turnstyles. Along the smashed a broken platform. They vanish into the darkness.  ll. THE BURLAP HOOD IS PULLED FROM CORNELIUS' HEAD. He strugg cannot move. The humans have tied him to a chair with Pax lap.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Untie us! What is the meaning of this? Untie us!

dialogues.speaker: IN A SMALL DARK ROOM OFF TO ONE SIDE OF THE SUBWAY TRACKS
dialogues.text: Cornelius struggles to free himself. The humans run from room.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait! Where are you going? Cornelius looks around nervously. His emotions are a mixt curiosity and fear. Pax hugs him tightly around the neck.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh dear...Don't be frightened Pax. He stares out the doorway at the subway tracks. He's neve anything like this before, then...Cornelius' eyes widen a hears a noise. Outside the doorway the silhouette of a sm human CHILD runs by. The child giggles. SUDDENLY...the silhouette of a large human MAN steps into doorway. He carries a rifle. Although Cornelius cannot se face, he knows the man is staring directly at him. The silhouettes of two human CHILDREN play at the man's ankle Slowly the man walks forward... Cornelius’ heart pounds i throat. Sweat beads on his brow. The man steps into a sha light. His face becomes illuminated. Cornelius grins with relief. He can't believe his eyes. IT _IS_ TAYLOR.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: (overcome) Taylor! Taylor its stunned.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Cornelius? Cornelius is that you? Taylor runs to untie them..

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Taylor, thank goodness you're alive. The two embrace like the old friends that they are.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I thought I would never see you again.  12.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how happy I am to find you after all these years.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Well, you sure are a sight for sore eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: I've missed you, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry about the welcome. I just had no idea it was you. (looking to Pax) Is this your son?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Yes, this is Pax. The three children all eye each other skeptically. The li tugs at Taylor's leg. It is his 3 year old son, DUKE.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: And who do we have here? Taylor scoops Duke up into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Cornelius, I'd like you to meet my son, Duke. I named him after John Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: who?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Never mind. Duke this is my old friend, Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Well, hello.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Oh, he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Of course. Cornelius looks down at the little girl .

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: And hello down there to you too.  13.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Cornelius, Pax, this 1s Duke's little friend, Ariel.

dialogues.speaker: ARIEL
dialogues.text: You look funny. Cornelius and Taylor look at each other and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remnants of a once bustling commuter breakfast spot i ancient ruin. The formica counters are warped. The walls chipped. And, the cushions on the chairs have faded to du Taylor has fashioned it into his dining room. Cornelius a Taylor sit in a booth feasting vegetarian-style. Duke, Ar Pax play on the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: «..I look around and see what has become of your civilization, and know this {s what's in store for ours if something is not done. I beg you, Taylor, you are our only hope.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: But I don't understand what I can do. I am only one. And a human to boot. Why would he listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Because you are proof that it has happened before. Living proof of a culture that was completely destroyed by fighting itself.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Look, my civilization fought a thousand wars before one of them finally blew everything up.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: But Taylor how can you suggest the apes take the same path as the humans? You better than anyone knows the grizzly consequences. Playfully, Duke and Ariel run to Taylor. He takes them in arms and places one on each knee. Pax runs to Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Cornelius, listen, I understand why you're scared, but I have a responsibility here. Duke has already lost his mother. What if he were to lose me too?  14.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: We have a lot in common, my friend. hore than a f€lrst glance might tell. Cornelius looks at Duke and as a father himself he feels for Taylor's circumstance. He suddenly realizes he has pu Taylor in a compromising position.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say no more. I understand... Now show me around this...what you call a subway. Taylor obliges his old friend. Duke, Ariel, and Pax run o play. Taylor walks behind the archaic counter. Next to wh once a cash register, Taylor picks up an object.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Let me teach you a little something about the twentieth century. Taylor tosses the object to Cornelius. He's a good catch.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: It's a package of Twinkies. A very integral part of human existence. Cornelius examines it curiously. Go ahead. Eat it. It has a shelf life of over three thousand years. Cornelius rips open the cellophane. He takes a bite. It's fresh. He likes it.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Come with me Cornelius. I think you might find this interesting. IN A SMALL ROOM off to one side Taylor shows Cornelius an unexpected sight...a classroom in progress. A TEACHER is a group of about S HUMANS how to speak.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Since I've been living in the Forbidden Zone I've taught a group of people some basics, speaking, reading, thinking for themselves. They're all very fast learners.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: How positively wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: There's more.  1s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old decrepit chairs and vinyl couches line the filthy wal There is a rotted desk that Taylor obviously uses for his From out of a desk drawer Taylor takes three large handbo handwritten books. History books.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Books?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: History books. A chronicle of the human existence as I can recall it. Cornelius thumbs through one of the books.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: This is fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Every night I write a few pages. Things I was taught in school, from TV, movies...I really miss movies. My favorite was "Ben Hur". (seriously) I've been racking my brains trying to remember history as it occured. I can't let it be forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: You've written so much. I had no idea the humans had this much history to tell.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Cornelius, I've only scratched the surface. Our great libraries were stacked from floor to ceiling with thousands of volumes of books, and even they weren't able to tell it all. I'm amazed at myself for having remembered this much already.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Your son is lucky to have such a father.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: He's why I started writing these. So the history of the humans won't be forgotten. So my child and all the children can read about it for generations to come... Taylor stops. He thinks about what he has just said. ++-generations to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General Assembly Room of the League of Anthropoid Nat a hot-bed of confrontation. The room is circular. Seated on multi-leveled risers are both warring factions. The CHIMPANZEES occupy one side of the room. The GORILLAS the side. Nebb Gurio, leader of the chimpanzee forces, sits i position of control mid-way up the wall of his SOLDIERS. at the other side of the room opposite Gurio. Seated in a high atop everyone, the two remaining orangutan judges sp Words fire back and forth like gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: GURIO
dialogues.text: You're mad! You're utterly mad! There's no reasoning with a barbarian!

dialogues.speaker: IZAN

For once the warring gorillas and chimpanzees have someth laugh at together. Not even lizards or dogs. Something we could almost believe...But humans! Cornelius puts Pax down. He raises the books high above h

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I'm not a hoax General. I'm not a trick. I haven't been trained to mock language like a parrot. I ama human being, and as much as you apes want to hide from the truth, there was a day when humans ruled this entire planet. There are some snickers bouncing about the room. Sure, it's funny, I know. But why don't zou ask the orangutans? They know it's true. They wrote your sacred scrolls and have been keeping the human existence secret from the moment apes stood upright. Taylor points to the orangutans sitting up in the booth. hides his face in his hands. What were you afraid of? Didn't you realize by turning your heads from the past and ignoring history, you're doomed to repeat it? A uneasy calm envelopes the room. Taylor continues. There was a time when man had the knowledge and power to clean the oceans, cure the sick, feed the hungry, and fly to the stars. That's how I got here. I was an astronaut. I flew through space and time in a machine that humans built. I know this must seem hard to believe. You may very well be asking yourselves, if such a great civilization did exist, where {s it  20.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: now? Well, I am all that is left. You see, with all the wonderous things that humans could do, we had one fatal flaw. The inability to share. The unwillingness to cooperate. The refusal to look upon each other as equals. Man's great downfall can be defined as simply as petty greed. And it was that greed, that insidious thirst for power that led us to war after war after war. And each war was the war to end all wars...Until finally one war ended everything!..... ee eeeene I beg you, for the sake of your race, don't make the same mistake we made. Learn from our stupidity. Learn from our selfishness. And rise higher than man ever dreamt possible. It's not too late. It can never be too late. You can hear a pin drop. Izan slowly stands. He removes h His expression is introspective and absorbing. SUDDENLY.. pulls a pistol from his side. He points it at Gurio. BLAM single bullet blows Gurio's forehead apart. His limp body back. An arc of red follows. The warlords are shocked. Ta mortified.

Shot in the street for handing out flyers in a peaceful non-violent manner. Times are different Professor. Besides, we're not the Simiantarian Peace Organization anymore. dialogues.text: Duke grabs an end of the pole. The Machine grabs the othe The Machine swings the pole lifting Duke off his feet. Wi mighty swat Duke goes flying through the air. The flies through the air like a wayward helicopter propeller SMACKS Wynora's ankles and tangles up her feet, sending h tumbling forward. Duke SCRAMBLES to her side. They look up. The Machine is barreling toward them. Thinking quickly, Wynora and Duke each grab an end of the They jump to their feet, holding the pole like a low limb Duke and Wynora charge toward him. CRACK. The Machine hit pole with his shins. He soars forward off his feet, and C He hits his head on the stone wall knocking him unconscio The crowd GASPS in concerned horror. This has never happe before. JEERS ring from the angry spectators. Duke takes Wynora's hand and runs with her to the center ring. They bow to all sides. Winners. Izan clenches his teeth. He is furious, but acts cool. Pax turns to his father.

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: (more visibly upset) Father, shoot them.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (looking into the ring, grins) Not yet. Pax looks at Duke and Wynora. Duke and Wynora are waving to the crowd. Smiles beam acro thelr faces. Suddenly, from behind them, ja n tan The crowd goes insanely wild. Unbeknownst to Duke and Wynora the Machine walks up behin He puts his arms around each of their shoulders and smile Their expressions drop. Their hearts sink into their stom The Machine waves to his adoring fans. Izan and Pax are e  88.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: {to the Machine) I don't suppose we could finish this up tomorrow? The Machine's smile slowly fades to a scowl. He knocks Wy away with one arm. she goes sailing. The Machine takes hi other massive arm and tightens it around Duke's neck in a grip headlock. Duke is in agony. Out of respect the Machine turns to Izan. Will it be thru or thumbs down? The audience goes silent. Surprise! It's thumbs down. The Machine digs his fingers into the fleshy part of Duke The beast lets out a mighty ROAR of triumph. Suddenly... Wynora THRUSTS the wooden pole into the Machine's gaping

dialogues.speaker: CHOKE
dialogues.text: The Machine drops Duke and REELS backward. He YANKS at th that is lodged in his throat. Duke scrambles to his feet. He and Wynora run like the wi Izan is enraged. He grabs the megaphone and bellows to th Machine.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (fuming) What the hell is the matter with you, dammit? Kill them you idiot. Kill them or die! With a forceful TUG the Machine pulls the pole out of his windpipe. CRACK. He breaks the pole over his knee and spi wad of blood. Boy is he mad. The Machine takes off after Wynora and Duke like a rocket and Wynora are running with all their might. They dash st for the wall. The Machine is gaining fast. With a burst of adrenelin strength Duke jumps off the gro grabs onto the top of the restraining wall. He hoist hims into the front row of the bleachers. The shocked fans scu Duke reaches down for Wynora's hand. He heaves her up the Just as she is about to clear, the Machine grabs her foot will she escape? Her shoe comes off.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (raging into the megaphone) Will you stop embarrassing me, you moron, and get them.  89. Duke and Wynora storm up the bleachers through the scatte spectators. The Machine VAULTS the wall and CHARGES through the crowd them like a bulldozer killing and knocking apes out of hi left and right. Izan isn't getting his money's worth. He watches the fren action with a scowl on his face. Duke and Wynora speed through aisles on a mad dash for th lives. They dart in and around seats. Over scattering fan And up to the top of the colisuem. The Machine follows cl behind. The harrowing chase continues along the upper ledge of th coliseum. Duke and Wynora do thelr best to balance as the along the narrow top rim. The panoramic view of Ape City and the desert behind them Spectacular. The crowd is going nuts. The Machine is hot on Duke and Wynora's tail. The pace is and furious. Suddenly, for lack of a shoe, Wynora loses h footing and falls over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: (screams) Duke!! She grabs the ledge for dear life. Clinging by her finger Wynora dangles sixty feet above [zan Square. Duke rushes aid: He pulls with all his might, still trying to maintai alance. Like a Sasquatch the Machine is getting closer. As Duke strains to save Wynora his eye catches movement i distance. He looks out and is stunned at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) oh amy!

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Duke turns his head. There's the Machine. In a single bolt of blind strength Duke heaves Wynora und arm and leaps over the edge.  90. Duke and Wynora fly through space. with his free arm Duke grabs a flagpole. The force of the bodies send them spiraling down the flagpole like a corks Down, down, down they spin. At the top of the coliseum the Machine hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (furflously) After them you imbicile. The Machine looks to Izan in disbellef.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP
dialogues.text: The Machine jumps off the edge for the flagpole. Like a g terradactile he soars through the air. Grabbing the flagp his massive weight proves too much. SNAP. The pole breaks Machine tangles up in the flag of Izan as he plummets to ground. SLAM. He hits the pavement like a slab of meat. OUTSIDE THE ARENA... All the armed guards and screaming fans pour out of the c doors and into Izan Square. Duke clutches his ankle. Wynora pulls at him.

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: (frantic) Come ont! Duke tries to right himself, but collapses again.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (in pain) It's my foot. Run Wynora run!

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: (tugging at him) You can do it! Come on! The guards charge closer. Duke screams at Wynora with rage.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Gott! Determined, Wynora grabs Duke's arm to drag him if she ha  91.

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: Damn you! Duke tries as hard as he can to move with Wynora. She piv run...Suddenly she is face to face with a rearing horse. SCREAMS. It is Ariel. There in front of them on horseback stand Ariel, Corneliu the human army poised and ready to take off like lighteni

dialogues.speaker: ARIEL
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: fynora hoists Duke onto the back of Ariel's horse. Duke a iss.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Ariel!

dialogues.speaker: ARIEL
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you're alive. Wynora leaps onto Cornelius’ horse.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: (to Duke) Thank heavens you're safe.

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: Let's get the hell outta here! Their horses rear to charge, but... It's too late. They're surrounded on all sides by gorilla guards, rifles pointing at their heads. Trapped like rats. Suddenly Izan's evil volce BELLOWS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Dead-silence. Score of APES surround the action, riveted. Amongst them Wingding, Liam, Miles, Orpheus, and Professo Cornelius shudders. Izan steps out from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cornelius, Cornelius, what a pleasant surprise. (to the crowd) Now here before me stands an ape I truly never thought I would see again.  92.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Hello Izan. We have not come for trouble, only for Duke. And now if you'll excuse us.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Not so fast. Not so fast. It's been so long since we've seen each other. Let me get a good look at you. (scopes him up and down) You've gotten old Cornelius. (chuckles) I want to introduce you to someone. Cornelius' eyes widen. Pax steps out from the crowd and joins Izan. Cornelius’ b is taken away by the sight of his son. He is speechless. Duke and Ariel are concerned. This must be torture. Pax's eyes widen but he quickly resumes a cold glare at Cornelius. Izan SMIRKS.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Cornelius, have you ever met my son Pax? Pax makes eye contact with Duke, then speaks in a tone to Izan.

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: Father, who ts this old chimp?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (screams out) You know who he is Pax!

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Shut-up! (to Cornelius) Look at him, the pride of my Empire. Someday this all will be his. And he'll rule it my way! Pax stares at Cornelius as if he wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look around you Cornelius. What do you see? Cornelius sits motionless.  93.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wealth. Power. Fear. You were wrong. Taylor was wrong. I was right! Strength will always triumph over words. Izan LAUGHS at Cornelius and his group of humans.

dialogues.speaker: TZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this what you came here to battle me with? A pathetic handful of humans on horseback? How typical Cornelius. How very typical.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: We didn't come here to battle. We came for Duke.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Cornelius is a braver ape than you are Izan. He doesn't have to hide behind guards and guns and power.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Duke! Izan is getting very angry.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of him Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Enough of this nonsense. I'm getting very bored with Duke. GUARDS! Take aim. RIFLES COCK.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: This is the last anyone will ever hear from a talking human. Guards. Kill the mutant.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Not

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: Nol Suddenly A VOICE rings out.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEL
dialogues.text: Tf it's mutants you want, then you'll have to kill me too!

dialogues.speaker: ALBERT
dialogues.text: And me!

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Who said that?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Who do you think Izan?

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: I did fzan!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Us mutants! THEN Izan, beside himself, realizes the voices are human.

dialogues.speaker: DARA
dialogues.text: T£ you kill Duke then kill me too.

dialogues.speaker: ARIEL
dialogues.text: What's the matter Izan, you scared?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Izan, you look like you've seen a ghost! The guards are spooked. Izan is in shock that all the hum speak. Their voices ring out loudly. They all shout at on

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE HUMANS
dialogues.text: Wake up to the truth...Let us go... Peace on earth...Power to the people. . Power to the spoken word...etc. The noise level grows. It's driving Izan insane. THE HUMA SHOUT LOUDER AND LOUDER. It is a frenzied whirlwind of confusion. Pax is smiling at this circus.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: (screams over the noise) You cannot hide from the truth anymore Izan. You've built a kingdom on lies. Now let the truth tear it down. More crazed than ever before Izan SHOOTS his pistol into and SCREAMS at the top of his lungs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In_a desperate move of insanity Izan holds the gun agains head. Pax 1s horrified. what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: Father!!

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: (panicked) Izan don't!

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (bellowing to Cornelius) Nobody makes a fool of Izan! I warned you long ago Cornelius if you ever came back here I would kill your son! Pax is shocked. It's true.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Please Izan, no! I beg of y Spare my son! Spare Pax! K instead! ! ‘oul 411 me

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Cornelius, no! Cornelius jumps off his horse and runs to Izan and Pax.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Kill me! Kill me! But let Pax livet Izan sneers.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (pressing the gun into Pax's temple) Kill you instead of Pax? That wasn't the original agrement Cornelius. You wouldn't want me to go back on my word, would you?

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: Father, please.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Take me. Spare my son. Izan takes the gun away from Pax's head.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Pax lives. You die!  96. Duke and Ariel are mortified.

dialogues.speaker: ARIEL
dialogues.text: (shouts to Cornelius) Cornelius we need you. Cornelius raises his hand to silence her.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (to Pax) Pax, prove your loyalty to me and to the gorillas. Put a bullet between this chimp's eyes! Duke and Ariel look at each other, fear on their faces. Cornelius' eyes bug. with a glare of ice Pax raises his pistol from his holste points it at Cornelius. Izan grins. Pax stares into Cornelius' desperate eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: (whispers) Always remember I am your real father. There is a uneasy stillness. Pax COCKS the gun. Everyone waits. Pax's hand begins to tremble. Izan scowls.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (screams) Shoot! Pax's hand quivers even more. Izan is becoming furious.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shoot dammit...Shoot!! Ferociously Izan points his own gun at Cornelius and COCK Just as he is about to pull the trigger... wo an! The crowd is stunned. Tzan ts livid.

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: Don't!  97.

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (screams) You wouldn't dare!

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: (with the evil that Izan has taught) Drop your gun!

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (screams again) You wouldn't dare!

dialogues.speaker: IZAN
dialogues.text: (smirks) I've taught you well, you selfish, ungrateful, little chimp. You will pay dearly for this. I should have known...Once a chimp, always a chimp. As he speaks SUDDENLY... From behind Izan a hulking black monolith slowly rises to feet and INTO FRAME...THE MACHINE! Pax's eyes bulge. Cornelius quakes. Duke, Ariel, and Wyno petrified. Izan is unaware, until... The Machine's titanic hand CLAMPS down on Izan's shoulder vice. Izan reacts with unbridled horror. The Machine whips Izan to face him. He clenches Izan's throat and lifts him off feet as if he were weightless. BANG. BANG. BANG. BANG. Izan empties his gun into the Machine's chest. The Machine doesn't flinch. Then... The Machine SQUEEZES with his giant hands until... CRACK! Izan's neck snaps. His eyes roll over black. His p hits the ground. The Machine lets go of Izan's limp body. THUD. It hits th pavement. Blood pours from the Machine's chest and mouth. He REARS head and ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: THE MACHINE
dialogues.text: I always wanted to do that. Then he falls forward...dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chilling silence. All eyes turn to Pax. Pax stands for while over Izan's body. No one dares to move. Pax's eyes survey all the staring faces. He is emotionless. Pax walk to a huge statue of Izan which towers over all of Izan sq His footsteps are the only sound heard. He leaps onto the base of the massive statue.

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: (shouting to al

Izan is dead! The legacy has come to pass. The Empire of the Apes is mine! The crowd listens silently. Pax, a chimpanzee, will rule his Empire. Izan taught me leadership. Izan taught me strength. He taught me to rule relentless and hard. To rule with an iron £ist. To rule his way. There's a tension in the air. What is he leading to?

dialogues.speaker: PAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a dramatic pause) But Izan was right...Once a chimpanzee, always a chimpanzee! From this day forward things will be run my way. This day has opened my eyes to something I have been refusing to see for too long. I'm tired of the lies. I'm sick of the bloodshed. And I'm weary from the hatred. Pax SHOUTS with a passion never heard before.

dialogues.speaker: PAX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Today {ts a good day, for Izan's death marks the birth of a new age. The rules have changed. The mol has been broken. The torch has been passed to a new generation of primates. Let the curtain of Oppression rise. And let the sun sh ne down on the Planet of the pes. At that very instant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The head of the statue of Izan that Pax 1s standing under UP in a ball of white fire. Sand, ash, and sparks shower the masses like confetti on New Year's Eve. The crowd EXPLODES into raucous cheers of happiness. Amidst the hoopla Pax reaches out his hand to Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: PAX
dialogues.text: Father. Cornelius takes Pax's hand. He is hoisted up onto the bas the statue. He stands with his son. Pax waves to the jubilant throngs. The humans jump down from their horses and rejoice with t There is dancing in the streets. Ariel and Duke hug. They never expected this. Orpheus and Liam make their way through the bustling crow Wynora.

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA
dialogues.text: Which one of you planted that dynamite? Liam and Orpheus point at each other simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: WYNORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (laughing) Perfect timing. We couldn't have Planned it better if we tried. For a Simiantarian this is paradise. They hoot and holler together. Cornelius and Pax are waving to the masses. They look at other and suddenly twenty years are erased. Cornelius put arms around his son. They hug. In a burst of youth, Professor dances with a guard, squar style. All across the Empire the flags of Izan are being ripped from their flagpoles. The posters of his face are being t the walls. Miles and Singding are breaking open cages of HUMAN SLAVE setting them free to join the jubilation. Wynora and Duke hug. Suddenly Wynora hears her name being She looks up to see Pax holding out his hand to her. She cautiously takes it and stands next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to wynora) You are a brave chimp Wynora. I like what you stand for. I will need your help. Wynora and Pax stare into each others eyes. She nods and CLOSE ON ARIEL AND DUKE as they kiss passionately. WE SLOWLY PULL UP...UP...UP to an AERIAL VIEW of the Ape we hover above the mass celebration in the streets, Ariel narration is heard.

dialogues.speaker: ARIEL, (VO)
dialogues.text: And so the Planet of the Apes was given a second chance. The legend would continue, but this time with a new hope for tomorrow and a valued lesson from yesterday. We all know Taylor would be proud of us. Perhaps from somewhere he's even watching down and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke and Ariel sit on a horse together. Orange light fill sky and glows on their faces. The Statue of Liberty juts half way out from under the sa symbol of freedom is as powerful today as it was thousand years ago. Duke and Ariel smile up at “Lady Liberty" and they are on the dawning of a new age.
